result.execSummary:
The defendant Diane J Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 25 days credit.
Concurrent with: Count 2, if revoked.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate per Agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Thaddeus M. or Suzanna B.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided (no surcharges).
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Attend 2 self-help meetings per week.
6 months of Day Report Center.

Cases 13CM503, 13CF1294 and 13CF1308 were dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes: STAYED - To be used at Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

Defendant Diane J Perez in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Erik J. Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for sentencing.
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
COUNT 1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 25 days), concurrent with count 2.
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S); concurrent with count 2.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  Thaddeus M. or Suzanna B.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges).
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate per agent.
*Attend 2 self-help meetings per week. 
*6 months of Day Report Center.

COURT COSTS:  $268 - apply bail.

CONDITION TIME on count 1 only:  90 DAYS - STAYED, to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours. 

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

***
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 2:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 25 days), concurrent with count 1.
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S); concurrent with count 1.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

COURT COSTS:  $268 - apply bail.  Any remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
Filed by the State with attached copy of criminal compliant on Waukesha County case 14CF362.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Diane J Perez in court with attorney Megan A. Barbara.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 3 is dismissed and read in as well as 13CF1294, 13CF1308 and 13CM503.  
Court orders a presentence investigation be completed.  
State is requesting the court revoke bond.  Defense objects. 
Court does not revoke bond but admonishes the defendant as to her bond conditions. 
Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on February 3, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Diane J Perez in court with attorney Megan A. Barbara.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
